body:
All paid up members of the regional branches of the Society for Free Radical Research are automatically members of the Society for Free Radical Research International (SFRRI) and are eligible for reduced registration rates at both the International Meeting of SFRRI and scientific meetings of the regional branches of SFRRI. Members of the Society also have access to other benefits.

The regional branches of SFRRI keep details of the name, contacts and membership category of each member.

*Membership Categories*

**A. Ordinary Members**

Persons who usually are employed and have an active interest and/or competence in the field of Free Radical Research. Ordinary members are entitled to vote and hold Office.

**B. Junior Members (students / clinical residents)**

Persons in full or part-time training or further study, who have an active interest and/or competence in the field of Free Radical Research. Evidence must be provided to the society of such training or study, if requested. They have the right to vote and hold office. Junior Members will automatically become Ordinary Members after a maximum of 5 years of Junior Membership.

**C. Honorary Members**

Senior physicians and scientists who have made an outstanding contribution to the field of Free Radical Research over a number of years. Honorary membership is awarded by nomination of the person concerned by at least three members of the Society, and subsequent ratification by the General Assembly of the Society. Honorary members have the right to vote and hold office.

**D. Emeritus (Retired) Members**

At the time of retirement, an ordinary member may become an emeritus member. Emeritus members have the right to vote and hold office.

**E. Corporate Members**

Corporations or other organisations, including commercial enterprises, interested in the activities and objectives of the Society. They shall not have the right to vote or hold office.
